bunpro.writeup: Theadverbial particleしかis often compared toだけ, in that it also expresses 'only'. However, unlikeだけ,しかcan only be used innegative statements. Due to this,しか〜ないis regularly translated as 'there's only (A)', or 'there's nothing but (A)'.しか〜ないmay be used to express numbers, or nouns. In this lesson we will examine nouns.Likeしか〜ない, the construction used for expressing numbers, when used before a noun, this expression will mean that nothing apart from that one 'thing' exists. Any verb may be used afterしか, but it must be in its ない (or ありません) form.Cautionwhenしかないdirectly follows a verb, the translation is a little bit different, and means that 'nothing apart from (A) can be done'. This is a separate grammar point that we will study a bit later.

examples.japanese: 犯人はまだ3人しか捕まっていない。
examples.english: Only 3 of the criminals have been caught so far.

examples.japanese: この店は牛丼しか置いていない。
examples.english: This store only has gyudon.

examples.japanese: 釣りに行って、一匹しか釣れないと悲しくなる。
examples.english: I get sad when I go fishing and only catch one fish.

examples.japanese: 明日から雨が降るから、今日行くしかない。
examples.english: Since it will start raining tomorrow, we have no choice but to go today.

examples.japanese: 遠いので、車で行くことしか出来ない。
examples.english: Because it is far away, you can only go by car.

examples.japanese: 「はい」と「いいえ」しか言わない人とは話しにくい。
examples.english: It is difficult to talk to people who only respond with 'yes' and 'no'.

examples.japanese: すみませんが、午後しか空いていないみたいです。
examples.english: I am sorry, but it looks like there is only space open in the afternoon.

examples.japanese: 冷蔵庫に牛乳しか残っていない。
examples.english: There is nothing but milk in the fridge.

examples.japanese: 手袋を一枚しか見つけられない。
examples.english: I can only find one glove.

dojg.description: A particle which marks an element X when nothing but X makes the expressed proposition true.

examples.japanese: (ksa).戸田さんしか煙草を吸わない・吸いません。
examples.english: No one but Mr. Toda smokes.

examples.japanese: (ksb).私は日本語しか知らない・知りません。
examples.english: I know nothing but Japanese.

examples.japanese: (ksc).それは江口さんにしか話していない・いません。
examples.english: I haven't told it to anybody but Mr. Eguchi.

examples.japanese: (ksd).私はご飯を一杯しか食べなかった・食べませんでした。
examples.english: I had only one bowl of rice.

examples.japanese: (a).パーティーには学生しか来なかった。
examples.english: Only students came to the party.

examples.japanese: (b).田村さんはサラダしか食べなかった。
examples.english: Mr. Tamura ate only salad.

examples.japanese: (c).私は日曜日(に)しか来られません。
examples.english: I can come only on Sunday.

examples.japanese: (d).この本はこの図書館(に)しかありません。
examples.english: Only this library has this book.

examples.japanese: (e).そこは車でしか行けない。
examples.english: You can go there only by car. / The only way you can go there is by car.

examples.japanese: (f).私は山田さんとしか話をしない。
examples.english: I talk only with Mr. Yamada.

examples.japanese: (g).この学校は学生が百人しかない。
examples.english: This school has only a hundred students.

dojg.writeup: ## しか always occurs with negative predicates.
dojg.formation:
## 

- (i)Noun
- しか
- 先生が(subject)→
- 先生しか
- No one but the teacher
- 先生を(direct object)→
- 先生しか
- No one but the teacher
- (ii)Noun+(Particle)
- しか
- 東京へ・に(direction)→
- 東京(へ・に)しか
- To nowhere but Tokyo
- 先生に(indirect object, agent)→
- 先生(に)しか
- No one but the teacher
- 日曜日に(time)→
- 日曜日(に)しか
- Only on Sunday
- 東京に(location)→
- 東京(に)しか
- Only in Tokyo
- (iii)Noun+Particle
- しか
- 東京で(location)→
- 東京でしか
- Only in Tokyo
- 車で(means)→
- 車でしか
- Only by car
- 山田さんと(reciprocal)→
- 山田さんとしか
- Only with Mr. Yamada
- 東京から(starting point/source)→
- 東京からしか
- Only from Tokyo
- 五時まで(ending point)→
- 五時までしか
- Only till five o’clock
- (iv)Quantifier
- しか
- 少ししか
- Only a little
